CANGING TIMES
THE TOWN OF LARKHALL HAS LONG BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH MINING.DURING THE LAST CENTURY THIRTY FOUR PITS WERE OPERATIVE AND AS RECENTLY AS 1969 ONE MINE WAS STILL WORKABLE.NOWADAYS MOST TRACES OF MINES HAVE BEEN COVERED UP WITH HOUSING SCHEMES AND NEW BUILDINGS AND ANY ONE VISITING OUR TOWN WOULD NEVER THINK OF LARKHALL AS BEING A MINING VILLAGE THE ONLY EVIDENCE OF THIS HISTORIC OCCUPATION IS A FEW MINERS COTTAGES SCATERED AROUND THE TOWN (MACNEIL STREET,UNION STREET). WHOLE FAMILIES WERE INVOLVED IN THE BOOM DAYS OF MINING EARNING A MEAGRE LIVELIHOOD DIGGING UNDERGROUND IN 8 HOUR SHIFTS FOR 8/9d (43 PENCE) IN THE 1930'S OR IN MINE_RELATED JOBS SUCH AS HOUSE CONSTRUCTION AND AMBULANCE DRIVING.
